bill_title: make an appropriation for an invasive species research project conducted by South Dakota State University.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation for an invasive species research project conducted by South Dakota State University. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Agriculture to provide for the engineering design, preconstruction activities, and construction of a wetlands filtration system to treat contamination by invasive species at McCook Lake in Union County. The department shall work with South Dakota State University's cooperative fish and wildlife unit to conduct an invasive species research project in conjunction with the wetlands filtration system. Section 2. The secretary of agriculture shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 3. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2014, shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.093 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
